{"id":1296901947,"question_id":3477,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"7 months, 2 weeks","timestamp":1719074865,"status":14,"status_display":"Time Limit Exceeded","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1296901947/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Operations to Make Binary Array Elements Equal to One II","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    //vector<int> ans;\n    int minOperations(vector<int>& nums) {\n        int sz = nums.size();\n        //minimum number of operations required to make all elements in nums equal to 1\n        //any index i from the array and flip all the elements from index i to the end of the array.\n        //ans.resize(sz);\n        //return helper(nums, 0);\n        int ans = 0;\n        for(int i=0; i<sz; i++) {\n            if(nums[i] == 1 )\n                continue;\n            else {  \n                ans++;              \n                for(int j=i+1; j<sz; j++) {\n                    nums[j] = 1- nums[j];\n                }\n            }     \n        }  \n        return ans;   \n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-operations-to-make-binary-array-elements-equal-to-one-ii","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
